Stats

Class searchData

  • java.lang.Object
    • Stats.searchData

  • public class searchData
extends java.lang.Object
    Author:
    John

    This is the search function which searches through the data.
    This method is called in other classes and isn't run directly on it's own.

    • Field Summary

      (package private) static java.sql.Connection conn 
      (package private) static java.sql.ResultSet rs

      searchData() 

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static void increaseSearchCountDish(java.lang.String searchedName)
      This method deals with increasing the dish search count.

      It is done by inserting a dish into the database based on the search string, so that users can search
      for anything even if it doesn't exist.
      static void increaseSearchCountRest(java.lang.String searchedName)
      This method is used to increase the search count for dishes that have been searched for.
      It creates a few SQL statements which are executed to obtain firstly, the restaurant name
      based on the search, and secondly updating that restaurant so that the search count
      is incremented by one.

    • Method Detail

      • increaseSearchCountRest

        public static void increaseSearchCountRest(java.lang.String searchedName)
        This method is used to increase the search count for dishes that have been searched for.
        It creates a few SQL statements which are executed to obtain firstly, the restaurant name
        based on the search, and secondly updating that restaurant so that the search count
        is incremented by one.

      • increaseSearchCountDish

        public static void increaseSearchCountDish(java.lang.String searchedName)
        This method deals with increasing the dish search count.

        It is done by inserting a dish into the database based on the search string, so that users can search
        for anything even if it doesn't exist. It uses insert ignore to insert a dish.

        The dishes count is then updated if it already exists, otherwise it becomes 1.
